intro: Petunga, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the genus Eupatorium and is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its blue to purple flower heads and feathery foliage. It typically grows in moist habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Petunga is often used in traditional medicine and is also a valuable nectar source for pollinators.
